description: Number of chordal graphs (or triangulated graphs) on n vertices.
comments: Graphs having no induced cycles of any length > 3, so every cycle in the graph has a chord, or is "triangulated".All such graphs are perfect.Euler transform of A048192. - _Eric M. Schmidt_, Mar 25 2015
links: S. Hougardy, Classes of perfect graphs, Discr. Math. 306 (2006), 2529-2571.
author: _Gordon F. Royle_
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 04 2008
a(12) added (using A048192) by _Eric M. Schmidt_, Mar 25 2015
a(13) and a(14) added (using A048192) by _Falk HÃ¼ffner_, Jan 15 2016
